biospec_descr.textblock: Blood samples will be stored frozen for future analysis.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine whether levels of inflammatory markers in
      circulating blood can correlate with risk for dangerous heart rhythms.  Patients with
      systolic heart failure, which has been shown to increase risk for dangerous heart rhythms,
      will be enrolled.  All subjects will have an implantable cardioverter-defibrillator (ICD) in
      place, which allows regular evaluation of heart rhythm.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  left ventricular ejection fraction [LVEF] <=35%

          -  ICD implant

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Recent myocardial infarction (12 weeks)

          -  Recent revascularization (12 weeks)

          -  Recent hospitalization for any cause (6 weeks)

          -  History of rheumatologic disease

study_pop.textblock:
Patients with cardiomyopathy (left ventricular ejection fraction [LVEF] <=35%) who are
        followed at our institution's ICD device clinic will have levels of circulating biomarkers
        (hs-CRP, IL-6, TNF-alpha, IL-1, sST2, MMP-1, CICP, CITP) and BNP assessed at three-month
        intervals for at least one year. Patients will be excluded from the study if they have had
        a recent myocardial infarction or PCI (within three months), or recent hospitalization.

        Patients with obvious primary inflammatory conditions (such as lupus and rheumatoid
        arthritis) will be excluded. Additionally, significant events (e.g., HF hospitalizations,
        revascularization, medication changes, and death) will be tracked at each follow up visit
        for further statistical analysis.

contact.last_name: Daniel P Morin, MD, MPH, FHRS

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.measure: to evaluate a large population of heart failure patients with regard to circulating biomarkers and rates of subsequent ventricular arrhythmias.
